item.title: tcpdump: Learning how to read UDP packets
item.description: Phil and I spent some of Friday afternoon configuring statsd: A network daemon that runs on the Node.js platform and listens for statistics, like counters and timers, sent over UDP and sends aggregates to one or more pluggable backend services We configured it to listen on its default port 8125 and then used netcat to send UDP packets to see if it was working like so:
